column4: If I have C D E and system reserve as Primary partitions, so I cannot create another partition, not even extended
Therefore, I'll have to format one of my existing partitions.
But someone told me that, I can't only format say, D and make it extended
So, I wanted to ask, I can or I cannot?
The person told me, if I want to format the partition, I'll have to format both D and E partitions.
you can move the last partition to an extended partition even, without needing to format anything.
I can?
How?
gparted
For that I need an extended partition
I don't have extended partition.
Thats the main problem
you CREATE one
and yes you can do it
I cannot, as I already have 4 primary partitions.
you can if you use gparted to do it
I do have gparted.
and gparted is telling me, I already have 4 primary partitions.
System Reserved, C D and E
can you convert primary partition to Extended?
Nope, unless you format.
But the question is, Is it have to be the last partition, that is E
or I can just format D and format it newly as extended.
wrong. but since you obviously are hopeless, I stop here. have a nice day formatting
